definition[0]: great suffering that is caused for example by being very poor or very sick
example[0]: What we are witnessing here is human misery on a vast scale.
example[3]: She looked away so that Tom wouldn’t see her misery.
example[4]: His face was a picture of sheer misery (=great unhappiness, with no other emotion).
example[5]: The news plunged him into abject misery (=extreme unhappiness).
definition[2]: someone who is always complaining and never enjoys anything
example[7]: What’s the matter with you, misery guts (=a name for someone like this)?
